item.title: about me
item.description: current assistant professor of statistics Econometric Institute, Erasmus School of Economics, Erasmus University Rotterdam past research fellow of statistics Department of Law and Economics, UnitelmaSapienza University of Rome education phd in methodological statistics at La Sapienza University of Rome (2020) msc in statistics and decision sciences at La Sapienza University of Rome (2016) bsc in statistics at La Sapienza University of Rome (2013) grants research grant for junior researcher “Avvio alla ricerca” (2017) award in Stats under the Stars (an Italian Statistical Society competition): best report (2017) academic services programme committee member of the conference “IES 2022: Innovation and Society 5.

item.title: materials and info
item.description: I am a statistician and my research is focused on the methodological and computational aspects of data analysis. The best feeling is when I can use my knowledge to solve practical and real problems. I am currently working on latent variable models, unsupervised classification and model-based composite indicators. ongoing projects seminars and talks events teaching material

item.title: ongoing projects
item.description: my current researches are: Cavicchia, C. and Vichi, M. Second-order Disjoint Factor Analysis a new latent factor model called Second-order Disjoint Factor Analysis in order to model an unknown hierarchical structure of the manifest variables with two orders. This is an second-order factor analysis, which - respect to the second-order confirmatory factor analysis - is exploratory, nested and estimated simultaneously by maximum likelihood method. A cyclic block coordinate descent algorithm is proposed to maximize the likelihood.

item.title: publications
item.description: refereed journal articles Cavicchia, C. and Sarnacchiaro, P. A multi-group higher-order factor analysis for studying the gender-effect in Teacher Job Satisfaction METRON, (2021) Cavicchia, C., Sarnacchiaro, P. and Vichi, M. A composite indicator for the waste management in the EU via Hierarchical Disjoint Non-Negative Factor Analysis Socio-Economic Planning Sciences, 73, (2021) Cavicchia, C., Vichi, M. and Zaccaria, G. The ultrametric correlation matrix for modelling hierarchical latent concepts

item.title: teaching material
item.description: supervisions I am currently supervising three msc theses on Econometrics at Erasmus School of Economics I am currently supervising three msc theses on Data Science for Marketing Analytics at Erasmus School of Economics I am currently supervising two master theses within the II level master Quantitative methods and models for decision support at University of Rome UnitelmaSapienza the last two years I have supervised fourteen bsc theses at Erasmus School of Economics on Adachi and Trendafilov (2018), Vichi and Kiers (2001) and Bluszcz (2016)
